Content-type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-transfer-encoding: 8BIT

For only storing content recieved with a specific (set of) content-type(s) you could write your own clone (eg. ResponseCodeRegExpFilter) of:
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/filter/ContentTypeRegExpFilter.html

Simply replacing the value to match the reqexp against from:
(CrawlURI)o).getContentType()
to: (CrawlURI)o).getFetchStatus()

Would be a nice filter to have

best
Bjarne Andersen

Frank McCown wrote:
> 
> 
> Is there an option to tell Heritrix to disregard (not store) responses
> that are 404, 5xx, etc? (Actually I don't know if 5xx responses are
> stored or not, but I see 404s in my arc files.) I'd like to have arc
> files with only content that received a 200 response. I looked through
> the user manual and couldn't find this issue addressed.
> 
> Additionally, it would be useful to me to have the arcreader tool output
> the HTTP response along with the other metadata (length, mime, offset,
> etc) when running it like this:
> 
>  >arcreader my.arc.gz
> 
> Are there any caveats I should be aware of before I make this enhancement?
> 
> Thanks,
> Frank
> 
>
